intro: Fumaria micrantha var. parlatoreana, commonly known as the Italian celandine, is a variant of the greater celandine. It is a flowering plant in the family Papaveraceae, characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is found in various parts of Europe. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. Its botanical features include a stout, branched stem and a capsule-like fruit that disperses its seeds.
